alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 3:16PM EST until December 17 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM EST, local law enforcement and social media posts indicate that numerous roads remain closed across Downtown Charleston due to flooding. The flooding resulted from a combination of heavy rain, generally 3 to 6 inches, and major tidal flooding. In addition, portions of Mount Pleasant, James island, and Johns Island have reported roadway flooding. The flood waters should gradually recede through the rest of the afternoon. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional significant rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, James Island, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Johns Island, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Maybank Bridge, James Island County Park and Charles Towne Landing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Areas most prone to flooding across Downtown Charleston include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
